RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino
United States Border Patrol Agent Ignacio Rodriguez Jr.
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the two checkpoints: Freer Immigration Checkpoint and Hebbronville Checkpoint

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: conducted vehicle inspections at the Freer immigration checkpoint, processed undocumented individuals, and noticed drop-offs on Farm-to-Market Road 2050; agents use routes to avoid checkpoints; monitored traffic on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 which mostly consists of ranchers, oil trucks, and occasional small cars from a nearby wind farm; stopped a white Malibu sedan transporting illegals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: held a hearing on the pending motions to suppress
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: highway where vehicles were inspected by United States Border Patrol and location of Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint: location where Agent Trevino was stationed and conducted inspections; checkpoint avoided by smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint Building: building where Agent Trevino processed undocumented individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol Station Parking Lot: parking lot adjacent to the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: conducted inspections and processed undocumented individuals at the Freer immigration checkpoint; investigated drop-offs on Farm-to-Market Road 2050; familiar with most vehicles on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, mostly belonging to farmers and oil field workers; followed suspicious vehicles; observed a white Malibu sedan with passengers who appeared stiff and uncommunicative; stopped the white Malibu sedan and discovered it was transporting illegals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Ignaci: called out vehicles going southbound during Agent Trevino's shift
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot where vehicles turned southbound and where drop-offs of undocumented individuals were noticed; used by smugglers to avoid checkpoints; primarily used by ranchers, oil trucks, and occasional small cars from a nearby wind farm; has intersections with Mills Bennett Road, San Pablo Road, and Santo Nino Road
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville Checkpoint: checkpoint on U.S. Highway 359 avoided by smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway connecting to Houston or San Antonio, used by smugglers after avoiding checkpoints; accessible via San Pablo Road and Santo Nino Road
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 359: highway with Hebbronville checkpoint; part of route used to avoid checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint and Hebbron: checkpoints avoided by smugglers using routes via Farm-to-Market Road 2050, U.S. Highway 59, and U.S. Highway 359
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth: rental car company used by smugglers to avoid losing personal vehicles in case of being caught
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett Road: dirt road intersecting Farm-to-Market Road 2050, approximately five to six miles south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: road extending east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050, near the wind farm and Moglia ranch house; provides access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moglia Ranch House: located near the wind farm and San Pablo Road, south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stag Ranch Trailer: located near the wind farm and San Pablo Road, south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santo Nino Road: also known as Dinn Ranch, extends east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050; provides access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dinn Ranch: also known as Santo Nino Road, extends east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050; provides access to Highway 16
